page.title: 09THE A303 AT WEYHILL.
page.content: The A303, the main road to the West, passes through Weyhill and has been a source of trouble for many years. Numerous accidents have occurred and there has been congestion causing delays for traffic especially at weekends in the Summer. Great numbers of lorries and other heavy traffic also use the road. To alleviate this a new stretch of dual-carriageway is under construction between Hundred Acre Corner roundabout, just outside Andover, and Thruxton Down. This road will eventually bypass Weyhill, allowing it to return to the quiet village it used to be. New bridges have been built to take existing roads and the railway and the bridge at Mullen's Pond is being extended to accommodate the second carriageway. It is hoped to complete this work and open the new road by early 1986.
